data.title: Really cute shop with a wide variety!
data.text: This place is such a great deli and had so many other little things you might want for a picnic lunch. It was really busy the day that I want but the staff was keeping up which was nice. They were a bit pricey but that's to be expected from a boutique type deli. Overall, I would rate my experience 4/5.

data.title: Great quality food quickly!
data.text: GCM serves high quality food with an artisan flare in a great downtown location.  The burgers grilled on the spot are delicious as well as the sandwiches and daily specials.

data.title: Quaint stop for food and market items!
data.text:
Stopped here for a quick bite on the afternoon of Saturday August 27, 2016. What a quaint stop!  Deli items/salads, items in the coolers they will warm up for you, salads wraps and sandwiches they'll make for you, market items on the shelves to pick up for later, coolers full of interesting thirst quenchers, wines, beers and other goodies.  Amazing ginger cookie ~ YUM!  Nifty retro-looking cooler full of fancy ice cream bars... A few tables to sit down and enjoy your goods are also available.

I'm glad we stopped in and we will definitely be back!

data.title: Never Disappoints
data.text: I worked downtown and went to the Grand Central Market almost everyday for breakfast or lunch takeout. The Monroe Center sandwich is probably one of the best I've ever tasted. Also their breakfast sandwiches are amazing. Sent so many customers to them and they would come back raving about it. A jewel in the city.

data.title: Interesting
data.text:
We went on a jog from our hotel early morning on a rainy day to get some donuts from Propaganda before checkout.  To our chagrin, it was closed, so we ended up here as it was right next to our hotel.

It is an interesting place.....half market, half restaurant.  We got here before the lunch crowd and we were glad as it gets busy during lunch.  Looks to be family owned which we liked a lot.

They make great soups and sandwiches.  We enjoyed what we ordered and I would return here.  The coffee was pretty much awful, but I would get something else and be fine for a drink.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: This place is so great.  Awesome deli for lunch.  Lots of unique options or order something of your choice.  Great bread and really friendly staff.

data.title: Homemade suprises
data.text:
Stopped in on Fat Tuesday and saw they had Gumbo with Dirty Rice as the Special. Well I have tasted a lot of Gumbo so I really wasn't sure about this.  Took an order home and tasted it.  Immediately put it into my freezer and went back for another order to have for dinner.  True Southern Gumbo.  Deep rich flavors loaded with sausage (andouille) and seafood.  The gumbo had those wonderful flavors that come from working over it for hours. The dirty rice by itself had such wonderful flavors.
This Market has a wonderful selection of homemade foods to eat there or take home.  The menu is extremely varied with offers for vegetarian meals.  The prices are very reasonable.
This place is somewhere to visit and see for yourself.  Not far from Rosa Park and the Grand Rapids Art Museum.
